translated: He who knows the nature of all dharmas is exalted by the power of patience.üîΩHe is free from anger even when struck, threatened, beaten with fists and sticks, and wounded with weapons.

analyzed: yan lag dang nyid lag bcad kyang bzhin 'gyur ba med pa yin te /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i sems dang de 'gal ba yin pa'i phyir ro //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

translated: Just as space is pure by nature and is immeasurable, in the same way, the mind that has cultivated meditative concentration is extremely pure like space, naturally radiant, and uninterrupted.

analyzed: tshad kyis yongs su dpyad par mi nus pa'i phyir ro // zla ba'i 'od dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: ji ltar zla ba dang nyi ma'i 'od rang bzhin gyis 'od gsal ba yin no //
translated: Just as the light of the moon and sun is naturally radiant,

analyzed: zhes thams cad du bstan par bya'o //

analyzed: ji ltar tshon rtsi thogs nas bar snang nam mkha' la // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: rlung ni ji ltar phyogs bzhi dag nas langs pa dang zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: glu la'ang mi sred ces bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i yon tan 'di dag ste /
translated: These are the qualities of one who has attained meditative concentration.

analyzed: rnam pa sna tshogs pa'i rnam par rtog pa'i spyor ba yongs su spong ba la mkhas par blta bar bya'o zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la / byang chub sems dpa' gang zhig tshul khrims kyi phung po la rab tu gnas pa bdag la phan par 'dod pa bdag dang gzhan gyi don bsgrub pa'i phyir byang chub sems dpa'i spyad pa spyod pa de dag ni de bzhin gshegs pa mi bskyod pa'i sangs rgyas kyi

analyzed: de'i phyir gnod sems med cing kun mthun gyis //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and the following verses,

analyzed: kun mthun zhes @135a * //

original: byang chub sems dpa' sbyin pa la mos pa gang zhig gis rin po che de dag blangs nas bskal pa gangg'a'i klung gi bye ma snyed du sbyin pa btang ba bas /

original: gang gzhan dag gis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'di 'dzin par byed na bsod nams kyi phung po sbyin pa las byung ba de bas bsod nams kyi phung po 'di nyid mang du 'phel bar
analyzed: gang gzhan dag gis chos thams cad kyi rang bzhin mnyam pa nyid rnam par spros pa'i ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'di 'dzin par byed na bsod nams kyi phung po sbyin pa las byung ba de bas bsod nams kyi phung po 'di nyid mang du 'phel bar
translated: But if others were to uphold this King of SamƒÅdhis, the revealed equality of the nature of all phenomena, the accumulation of merit from the latter would be far greater than the accumulation of merit from the former, which arose from generosity.

analyzed: ting nge 'dzin gyi 'bras bu ni dpag tu med pa'i ye shes kyi tshogs rdzogs nas sangs rgyas nyid thob par 'gyur ba'o zhes bya ba yin no //

analyzed: de lta bas na ting nge 'dzin 'di 'thob par gyur na chos chen po mi zad pa'i chos kyi mdzod du 'gyur ro //

original: thos pa'i rgya mtsho thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: thos pa'i rgya mtsho thob par 'gyur ro //

original: chos kyi mchog rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pas //üîΩshin tu rgyas byas byang chub sems dpar brjod //
analyzed: chos kyi mchog rnams bsam gyis mi khyab pas // shin tu rgyas byas byang chub sems dpar brjod //

original: ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin thob pa'i byang chub sems dpa' la mchog dang / rab mchog dang / bsam gyis mi khyab pa dang / dpe med pa dang / legs par bsdams pa zhes brjod do //

analyzed: bsod nams dang / ye shes dang / brtson 'grus dang / stobs kyis de bas @135b lhag pa yod pa ma yin la /

analyzed: mnyam pa yang yod pa ma yin no / gzhon nu ci ste chos de gzugs yod na zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: des bskyed pa'i bsod nams kyi phung po de gal te chos gzugs can zhig yin na ni 'jig rten gyi khams thams cad yongs su gang bar 'gyur zhing nam mkha'i khams su yang shong bar mi 'gyur ro //

analyzed: de'i phyir bsod nams kyi phung po dpag tu med pa yongs su 'dzin par 'dod pa dang / 'das pa dang / ma byon pa dang / da ltar byung ba'i de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la mchod pa dang / bsnyen bkur yongs su spyad pa dang /
translated: Therefore, one who wishes to grasp an immeasurable heap of merit, and to make offerings and service to the TathƒÅgatas of the past, future, and present,

analyzed: sems kyis mnyes bar byed par 'dod pas kyang ting nge 'dzin gyi rgyal po 'di gzung bar bya'o //

analyzed: byang chub ces bya ba ni ting nge 'dzin mngon sum du byed pa 'di nyid la byang chub ces bya'o //

analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: de bzhin du rgya mtsho chen po'i bye ma ni tshad gzhal bar nus kyang srid /

translated: The bodhisattva who has attained meditative concentration is skilled in the etymologies and the entire meaning of the teaching, is skilled in the ascertainment of the meaning, has inconceivable pure intelligence, and penetrates and understands even the most subtle meanings.

analyzed: gzod ma nas ma skyes pa'i ngo bor sgra rnams rnam par rig pas de la yang mngon par zhen pa med par chos ston par byed do //

analyzed: thogs med de ni chos smrar brjod pa ste //

original: dri ba nges par ston pa brgya la mkhas //
analyzed: dri ba nges par ston pa brgya la mkhas //

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /

analyzed: sems can dpag tu med pas rgol pa yang dpag tu med pa 'byung la /

analyzed: de dag la lan 'debs pa la mkhas pa ni mkhas pa nyid do //

analyzed: @136b mdo sde gcig gi phyogs kyang bye ba snyed //

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /

original: 'khor gyi nang du chags pa med par ston pas na chags par mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: 'khor gyi nang du chags pa med par ston pas na chags par mi 'gyur te /
translated: Because of teaching without attachment in the midst of the assembly, he does not become attached,

original: dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: dmigs pa la mngon par zhen pa med pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because of non-adherence to the objective.

original: ting 'dzin 'di la legs par gang gnas pa ;
analyzed: ting 'dzin 'di la legs par gang gnas pa ;
translated: He who is well-established in this meditative concentration,

original: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: / zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: and so on.

original: ting nge 'dzin la legs par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni brag gi rang bzhin gyi ri rab bzhin du phas kyi rgol ba'i smra ba rnams kyis rab tu g-yos par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin la legs par gnas pa'i byang chub sems dpa' ni brag gi rang bzhin gyi ri rab bzhin du phas kyi rgol ba'i smra ba rnams kyis rab tu g-yos par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The bodhisattva who is well-established in meditative concentration, like the nature of a mountain, is not shaken by the discourses of adversaries.

original: rgol ba ma lus pa la dus gcig tu lan btab pas de dag thams cad zil gyis mnan nas mi smra bar sdod par gyur nas rang gi phyogs la 'jog par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: rgol ba ma lus pa la dus gcig tu lan btab pas de dag thams cad zil gyis mnan nas mi smra bar sdod par gyur nas rang gi phyogs la 'jog par byed do zhes bya ba'o //
translated: Having simultaneously replied to all adversaries, he overwhelms them all, and they become silent and sit down, and he establishes his own position.

original: su dag stong pa nyid la rtag brtson pa //
analyzed: su dag stong pa nyid la rtag brtson pa //
translated: Those who are always diligent in emptiness

original: sangs rgyas gnas su nges pa de yin te //
analyzed: sangs rgyas gnas su nges pa de yin te //
translated: are certain to attain the state of a Buddha.

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: sangs rgyas rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas rnams dang byang chub sems dpa' rnams ni stong pa nyid la gnas pa'o //
translated: The Buddhas and Bodhisattvas abide in emptiness.

original: gang gis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rab tu shes pa de ni pha rol gyi rgol ba thams cad kyis bskyod par nus pa ma yin no //
analyzed: gang gis chos thams cad stong pa nyid du rab tu shes pa de ni pha rol gyi rgol ba thams cad kyis bskyod par nus pa ma yin no //
translated: One who knows all things as emptiness cannot be shaken by any opponent.

original: de'i phyir mi 'khrugs pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / zil gyis ni mi non par 'gyur te /
analyzed: de'i phyir mi 'khrugs pa dang / mi bskyod pa dang / zil gyis ni mi non par 'gyur te /
translated: Therefore, he becomes unshakable, unmoved, and unassailable.

original: byang chub sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid chen po mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' chen po ting nge 'dzin bsgoms pa'i bdag nyid chen po mthu chen po dang ldan pa'i rang bzhin can yin no zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The Bodhisattva becomes one who has the greatness of the cultivation of samadhi, who has the nature of great power.

original: de yis stong nyid rtogs par khong du chud //
analyzed: de yis stong nyid rtogs par khong du chud //
translated: He has understood the realization of emptiness.

original: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: ces bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Thus, etc.

original: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid rtogs par khong du chud nas chos thams cad la nem nur dang / the tshom dang / yid gnyis yod par mi 'gyur ro //
analyzed: byang chub sems dpa' stong pa nyid rtogs par khong du chud nas chos thams cad la nem nur dang / the tshom dang / yid gnyis yod par mi 'gyur ro //
translated: The Bodhisattva, having understood the realization of emptiness, has no doubt, uncertainty, or indecision about any dharma.

original: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob na thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: de bzhin gshegs pa'i stobs bcu dang / byang chub kyi yan lag bdun dang / so so yang dag par rig pa bzhi dang / rdzu 'phrul gyi rkang pa bzhi dang / mngon par shes pa lnga la sogs pa ni ting nge 'dzin thob na thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: The ten powers of the Tathagata, the seven aspects of enlightenment, the four forms of correct knowledge, the four forms of supernatural knowledge, the five forms of spiritual vision, etc., are attained when one attains meditative concentration.

original: stobs la sogs pa rnams sngar bshad zin pas yang bshad par mi bya'o //
analyzed: stobs la sogs pa rnams sngar bshad zin pas yang bshad par mi bya'o //
translated: Since the powers, etc., have already been explained, they will not be discussed here.

original: @137a * // de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa mthong ba dang rtag tu mi 'bral ba dang / chos nyan pa la gcig tu zhen pa'i ye shes bla na med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob pa dang /
analyzed: @137a * // de bzhin gshegs pa dpag tu med pa mthong ba dang rtag tu mi 'bral ba dang / chos nyan pa la gcig tu zhen pa'i ye shes bla na med pa dang yang dag par ldan pa dang dpag tu med pa'i ting nge 'dzin la dbang thob pa dang /
translated: The bodhisattva who has attained the perfection of meditative concentration is endowed with the following qualities: he always sees innumerable Tathagatas and is never separated from them; he is endowed with the unsurpassed intuition that is intent on listening to the Dharma; he has attained mastery over innumerable meditative concentrations;

original: dpe med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa'i cho ga shes pa la mkhas pa de'i bsod nams kyi mtha' ni shes par sla ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
analyzed: dpe med pa'i ting nge 'dzin dpag tu med pa'i cho ga shes pa la mkhas pa de'i bsod nams kyi mtha' ni shes par sla ba ma yin no zhes bstan pa'i phyir /
translated: and he is skilled in the knowledge of the rites of innumerable, incomparable meditative concentrations. The limit of his merit is not easily fathomed.

original: nor bu rin chen dag gis gang gyur kyang //üîΩzhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: nor bu rin chen dag gis gang gyur kyang // zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: Even if the great trichiliocosm were filled with precious gems

original: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'og gis gzhi nas bzung nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rin po che sna tshogs kyis yongs su bkang nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bskal pa dpag tu med par sems can thams cad kyis sbyin par
analyzed: stong gsum gyi stong chen po'i 'jig rten gyi khams 'og gis gzhi nas bzung nas srid pa'i rtse mo'i bar du rin po che sna tshogs kyis yongs su bkang nas de bzhin gshegs pa rnams la bskal pa dpag tu med par sems can thams cad kyis sbyin par
translated: and one were to give them to the Tathagatas for immeasurable eons,üîΩand if someone else, with faith in emptiness, were to pay homage to the Tathagatas,

original: byed pa dang / gang chos kyi bdag nyid can zhig stong pa nyid la dga' bas de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed na snga ma'i bsod nams kyi phung po des bye ba'i char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi phung po shin tu rgya chenüîΩpo la 'jug pa'i rgyu ni ting nge 'dzin no //
analyzed: byed pa dang / gang chos kyi bdag nyid can zhig stong pa nyid la dga' bas de bzhin gshegs pa la phyag 'tshal bar byed na snga ma'i bsod nams kyi phung po des bye ba'i char yang mi phod do zhes bya ba ni bsod nams kyi phung po shin tu rgya chen po la 'jug pa'i rgyu ni ting nge 'dzin no //
translated: the former mass of merit would not reach even a hundredth part of that.üîΩThis is the cause for engaging in an extremely vast mass of merit.

original: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad nges par sgrub par gyur pa'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi yon tan thams cad nges par sgrub par gyur pa'o //
translated: It is the concentration that definitely accomplishes all the qualities of a Buddha.

original: bsod nams thams cad ni 'di'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
analyzed: bsod nams thams cad ni 'di'i brgya'i char yang nye bar mi 'gyur ro zhes bstan pa yin no //
translated: All merit is not even a hundredth part of this.

original: ting nge 'dzin dang bral ba'i sbyin pas ni myur du sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin no //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin dang bral ba'i sbyin pas ni myur du sangs rgyas nyid thob pa ma yin no //
translated: Generosity that is devoid of meditative concentration does not quickly attain buddhahood.

original: ting nge 'dzin nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa yang dag par ldan pas ni myur du thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin nyan pa dang / sems pa dang / bsgom pa yang dag par ldan pas ni myur du thob par 'gyur ro zhes bya ba'o //
translated: But by listening to meditative concentration, reflecting, and cultivating it, one quickly attains it.

original: gang gis 'di lta bu yi gter rnyed pa //
analyzed: gang gis 'di lta bu yi gter rnyed pa //
translated: One who finds such a treasure

original: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
analyzed: zhes bya ba la sogs pa la /
translated: In this and other passages.üîΩüîΩ

original: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa khyab par nor thams cad kyis yongs su gang ba'i gter rnyed pa na yang de phul du byung ba'i mdzod chen po can zhes mi bya'o //
analyzed: sangs rgyas kyi zhing dpag tu med pa khyab par nor thams cad kyis yongs su gang ba'i gter rnyed pa na yang de phul du byung ba'i mdzod chen po can zhes mi bya'o //
translated: Even if one finds a treasure filled with all kinds of wealth that pervades immeasurable buddha-fields, that is not called finding the supreme great treasure.

original: ting nge 'dzin thob pa de ni phul du gyur pa'i mdzod thul bar dka' ba thob par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ting nge 'dzin thob pa de ni phul du gyur pa'i mdzod thul bar dka' ba thob par 'gyur ro //
translated: But one who attains meditative concentration finds the supreme treasure that is difficult to overcome.

original: rgyal srid thob pas kyang dga' bar mi 'gyur te /
analyzed: rgyal srid thob pas kyang dga' bar mi 'gyur te /
translated: One does not delight in attaining a kingdom.

original: ngoms pa skyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
analyzed: ngoms pa skyed pa ma yin pa'i phyir ro //
translated: because it does not produce satisfaction.

original: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur na ni shin tu tshim par 'gyur ro //
analyzed: ji ltar ting nge 'dzin thob par gyur na ni shin tu tshim par 'gyur ro //
translated: But when one obtains concentration, one becomes very satisfied.
